title: Suicide Bug - check out my plate!! - ex Volksworld show car

posts.content:
This is my pride n joy but the Velvet Green bus fund needs topping up so something has to give. Thought I'd put it on here just in case someone knows someone looking for a custom bug. Or maybe just to have a conversation about and see what you think of her??

Full mot. 9 months tax. Very unusual beetle, with "suicide doors" and de-seamed, this was very well known on the scene up until about 10 years ago, then it vanished. It was a volksworld magazine feature car back in the day the car drives fast. All the steering, brakes and lights etc. are spot on, I have stripped the brakes freed, cleaned and lubricated etc.

She has an AB code engine upgraded to 1600. And I would want to do a full paint job and make it back into a show car again if I kept it Currently in primer which everyone says looks blinding as it is. Your choice!? It is one of a kind.

Porche 944 interior
1978
SUICIDE DOORS
ONE PIECE WINDOWS
DOORS OPERATED BY SOLENOIDS
WIDE 5 "EMPI'S
ADJUSTABLE FRONT BEAM
VDO GAUGES inc SPEEDO AND REV COUNTER,
1600 ENGINE
SHORT SHOCKS
WOOD RIM STEERING WHEEL
DROP SPINDLES
PRE 67 SLOPY WINGS
EARLY BACK LIGHTS
SHORT SHAFT GEARBOX
AMERICAN SPEC. HEADLAMPS REAR BODY GRILL, RADIUS DOOR TOPS.
Â£3950 which is a good price for this rare bug.

The GO FAST plate at the moment is in the process of coming off if it's something your interested in let me know but your pockets will have to be deep!

Loads more information to give and pictures of the lovely engine etc.

A sad day

What did it look like back in the day? Got any pics?


Nige

I've been hunting for 'the' magazine it was in without luck. It was all a dark blue turq colour which I've retained shaped around the vdo's. Bit of its old life still there I guess was the idea. I'll grab some more photos and see if I can upload.
Few more pictures added. The doors operate via solenoid accessed from the petrol cap. Press the button and they ping open!
Always garaged and never driven in the rain

I may end up keeping her so I'd like peoples ideas on what they'd do. I was toying with a wrap instead of spray job - maybe matt black with bullet holes down the side or an open metal zip running through the middle with something coming out of it. Or maybe you think metal flake style respray? Change the Empi's?

This is the custom toy and why my 67 Bus is staying stock. Best of both worlds.

Satin black with red hot rod scallops.

But then I might be a bit biased



Or how about sell the plate and keep the bug?

Cheers, Lee.

Yeah man that's cool I like it. Guess that's you bug then. Probably should have updated this thread that the bugs off the market. Silly idea and what was I thinking!
I probably would sell the plate but depends on offer prices. Just have to find the right buyer with the money.
I reckon I'll take her off the road when the bus is done (or at least MOT'd) and go to town on her.

Damm! I remember this first time around. Glad you opted to keep it. Love the curved top door frames.
When I finally get around to it I am going to copy a lot of this into my bug.....

Cheers mate, for the people who knew the bug a few years ago here are a couple of photos I've been supplied with. Interior has changed along with the lights and bumpers etc. I've got a set of twin carbs that will be fitted soon so she'll be beefed up for the summer.
Sold to fund my bus project and possible second bus!!! Don't tell the Mrs.......
Second bus......you hAvnt finished the first one yet!
